Command or Action
enable Example: Device> enable
configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
mpls label range minimum-value maximum-value [static minimum-static-value maximum-static-value] Example: Device(config)# mpls label range 16 200 static 300 500
pseudowire-class [pw-class-name] Example: Device(config)# pseudowire-class static_vpls
encapsulation mpls Example: Device(config-pw-class)# encapsulation mpls
protocol {l2tpv2 | l2tpv3 | none} [l2tp-class-name] Example: Device(config-pw-class)# protocol none
exit Example: Device(config-pw-class)# exit
l2 vfi vfi-name manual Example: Device(config)# l2 vfi static-vfi manual
vpn id vpn-id Example: Device(config-vfi)# vpn id 100
neighbor ip-address pw-class pw-name Example: Device(config-vfi)# neighbor 10.3.4.4 pw-class static_vpls
mpls label local-pseudowire-label remote-pseudowire-label Example: Device(config-vfi)# mpls label 301 17
mpls control-word Example: Device(config-vfi)# mpls control-word
neighbor ip-address pw-class pw-name Example: Device(config-vfi)# neighbor 2.3.4.3 pw-class static_vpls
mpls label local-pseudowire-label remote-pseudowire-label Example: Device(config-vfi)# mpls label 302 18
mpls control-word Example: Device(config-vfi)# mpls control-word
end Example: Device(config-vfi)# end
Purpose
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Enters global configuration mode.
Configures the range of local labels available for use with Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) applications on packet interfaces.
Specifies the name of a Layer 2 pseudowire class and enters pseudowire class configuration mode.
Specifies the tunneling encapsulation as MPLS.
Specifies that no signaling protocol will be used in Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol Version 3 (L2TPv3) sessions.
Exits pseudowire class configuration mode and returns to global configuration mode.
Establishes a Layer 2 VPN (L2VPN) virtual forwarding interface (VFI) between two or more separate networks, and enters Layer 2 VFI manual configuration mode.
Specifies the VPN ID.
Specifies the IP address of the peer and the pseudowire class.
Configures an Any Transport over MPLS (AToM) static pseudowire connection by defining local and remote circuit labels.
(Optional) Enables the MPLS control word in an AToM static pseudowire connection.
Specifies the IP address of the peer and the pseudowire class.
Configures an AToM static pseudowire connection by defining local and remote circuit labels.
(Optional) Enables the MPLS control word in an AToM static pseudowire connection.
Exits Layer 2 VFI manual configuration mode and returns to privileged EXEC mode.
pageTitle: MPLS Layer 2 VPNs Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS XE Release 3S (ASR 1000) - Configuring Virtual Private LAN Services [Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {4287=Jumbo frame support provides support for frame sizes between 1548 and 9216 bytes. You use the CLI to establish the jumbo frame size for any value specified in the above range. The default value is 1500 bytes in any Layer 2/VLAN interface. You can configure jumbo frame support on a per-interface basis., 12597=The following example shows how to assign IP address 10.10.10.1 to a bridge domain interface (BDI).}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 9.    end 8.    bridge-domain bd-id 7.    encapsulation dot1q vlan-id 6.    service instance si-id ethernet 5.    negotiation auto 4.    no ip address [ip-address mask] [secondary] 3.    interface type number 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS When Ethernet Virtual Connection Service (EVCS) is configured, a provider edge (PE) device forwards all Ethernet packets with a particular VLAN tag to a local Ethernet interface or emulated virtual circuit (VC) if the destination MAC address is found in the Layer 2 forwarding table. Note Configuring 802.1Q Access Ports for Tagged Traffic from a CE Device Configuring Q-in-Q EFP: Alternate Configuration Configuring Q-in-Q EFP Configuring Access Ports for Untagged
textAfterTable: Step 2 configure terminal Example:  Device# configure terminal   Enters global configuration mode.   Step 3 interface type number Example:  Device(config)# interface gigabitethernet 0/0/1   Specifies an interface and enters interface configuration mode.   Step 4 no ip address [ip-address mask] [secondary] Example:  Device(config-if)# no ip address   Disables IP processing.   Step 5 negotiation auto Example:  Device(config-if)# negotiation auto   Enables the autonegotiation protocol to configure the speed, duplex, and automatic flow control of the Gigabit Ethernet interface.   Step 6 service instance si-id ethernet Example:  Device(config-if)# service instance 10 ethernet   Specifies a service instance
